title: How To Overcome Depression, Deal With Depression
description:
There is no health without mental health.

In the past decade, depression rates have escalated, and one in four Americans will suffer from major depression at one time in their lives.

While there is no quick fix or one-size-fits-all for overcoming depression, this app tips can help you manage depression so it does not manage you.

If you’ve been struggling to figure out how to overcome depression, you may have turned to medications, talk therapy, lifestyle changes, and/or alternative treatments. Each can be effective, but they also won’t guarantee relief from that cloud of depression.

When you’re depressed, your motivation is at an all time low. It can be difficult to make yourself breakfast, or even get out of bed when you’re really in it.

Because of this, I’ve included a ‘seed habit’ tip in each section. The seed habit in each section is the easiest and most immediately actionable way to get yourself to engage in the behaviour, without having to overcome a major hurdle each time you lean into it. Think of it like your quick-start, easier-to-implement action step that you can take on today in order to get yourself on the fast track to feeling better.

- Remind yourself that rumination does not increase psychological insight.
- Take small actions toward problem-solving.
- Reframe negative perceptions of events and high expectations of others.
- Let go of unhealthy or unattainable goals and develop multiple sources of social supports.

At the end of the day, write down three things you did well. No need to overthink this, and no act of taking the high road is too small. For example, “When my coworker emailed the budget proposal, he forgot to cite a source. Rather than get upset, I spent two minutes researching the answer and added the information myself.”

Commit to a new way of thinking and you will commit to a new way of being. If living in the past takes up a lot of your mental real estate, this app will help you rewire your thought process. Past regrets serve one purpose and that is to rob you of your resolve to do things differently in the present.

Have faith in uncertainty, and in life. A good way to practice is by cultivating a state of mindfulness each and every day. When you learn to intentionally redirect your mind to what is happening in the here and now, you’ll increase your mental energy reserves so you can spend more time on enjoyable tasks. 

This app guide may help you develop structure and assess whether your time is well-spent based upon your productivity and moods.

Download How To Overcome Depression now for get more info.

You can bookmark Favorite articles(post)

You can share the article(post) to your friends, family and social networks.

title: DW Depression Pro
description:
Deep Waves Ltd. Depression is a brainwave sound therapy for depression.

Depression is a state of low mood and aversion to activity that can affect a person's thoughts, behavior, feelings and sense of well-being. People with depressed mood can feel sad, anxious, empty, hopeless, helpless, worthless, guilty, irritable, ashamed or restless. They may lose interest in activities that were once pleasurable, experience overeating or loss of appetite, have problems concentrating, remembering details or making decisions, and may contemplate, attempt or commit suicide. Insomnia, excessive sleeping, fatigue, aches, pains, digestive problems or reduced energy may also be present.

Potential targets of brain areas to stimulate and reduce symptoms of depression are as follows:

Deep Waves Ltd. Depression consist of 3 different sessions. 
Each session is 22 minutes. 

All sessions are needed to have a complete treatment!

This application requires large headphones or high quality earphones with Left and Right placed correctly !

Get ready for a total natural healing.

Enjoy your explorations.

title: Clinical Depression
description:
"Depression ranges in seriousness from mild, temporary episodes of sadness to severe, persistent depression. Clinical depression is the more-severe form of depression, also known as major depression or major depressive disorder. It isn't the same as depression caused by a loss, such as the death of a loved one, or a medical condition, such as a thyroid disorder.

To diagnose clinical depression, many doctors use the symptom criteria for major depressive disorder in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5), published by the American Psychiatric Association.
Signs and symptoms of clinical depression may include:

Feelings of sadness, tearfulness, emptiness or hopelessness
Angry outbursts, irritability or frustration, even over small matters
Loss of interest or pleasure in most or all normal activities, such as sex, hobbies or sports
Sleep disturbances, including insomnia or sleeping too much
Tiredness and lack of energy, so even small tasks take extra effort
Reduced appetite and weight loss or increased cravings for food and weight gain
Anxiety, agitation or restlessness
Slowed thinking, speaking or body movements
Feelings of worthlessness or guilt, fixating on past failures or self-blame
Trouble thinking, concentrating, making decisions and remembering things
Frequent or recurrent thoughts of death, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts or suicide
Unexplained physical problems, such as back pain or headaches
Symptoms are usually severe enough to cause noticeable problems in relationships with others or in day-to-day activities, such as work, school or social activities.

Clinical depression can affect people of any age, including children. However, clinical depression symptoms, even if severe, usually improve with psychological counseling, antidepressant medications or a combination of the two.
"

title: MoodMission - Cope with Stress, Moods & Anxiety
description:
MoodMission helps you learn new and better ways of coping with stress, low mood, depression, and anxiety. Tell MoodMission how you’re feeling and it will give you a tailored list of 5 Missions that can help you feel better and improve your wellbeing. 

Missions are mental health strategies that are quick, easily achievable, and backed up by scientific evidence, including:
★ Mindfulness meditations
★ Relaxation
★ Exercise and fitness activities
★ Affirmations and coping statements
★ Behavioural activation
★ Yoga
★ Gratitude
And heaps of other proven mood boosting activities.

It's a simple as doing a Mission and boosting your mood.

MoodMission is based in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), which is an evidence-based psychological therapy for anxiety and depression. Anyone can use MoodMission, whether you just want a lift in your day or need a bit more help recovering from anxiety or depression.

A randomised controlled trial has shown that MoodMission can improve mental health and wellbeing (Bakker et al., 2019), and two other studies published in scientific journals have provided further support (Bakker & Rickard, 2019; Bakker et al., 2018). Randomised controlled trials are the gold standard of scientific evidence, and very few available mental health apps have RCT support (Firth et al., 2018).

Completing Missions earns you rewards in the app, motivating you to take steps towards becoming healthier, happier, and more confident. Plus a Mission log helps you track your progress over time.

MoodMission learns which types of Missions work best for you, so the more you use MoodMission the better it gets at tailoring your Mission suggestions.

MoodMission is not a replacement for professional help. If you are experiencing anxiety, depression, or any mental health issue, talk to your GP or contact a psychologist for support.
descriptionHTML:
MoodMission helps you learn new and better ways of coping with stress, low mood, depression, and anxiety. Tell MoodMission how you’re feeling and it will give you a tailored list of 5 Missions that can help you feel better and improve your wellbeing.

Missions are mental health strategies that are quick, easily achievable, and backed up by scientific evidence, including:
★ Mindfulness meditations
★ Relaxation
★ Exercise and fitness activities
★ Affirmations and coping statements
★ Behavioural activation
★ Yoga
★ Gratitude
And heaps of other proven mood boosting activities.

It's a simple as doing a Mission and boosting your mood.

MoodMission is based in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), which is an evidence-based psychological therapy for anxiety and depression. Anyone can use MoodMission, whether you just want a lift in your day or need a bit more help recovering from anxiety or depression.

A randomised controlled trial has shown that MoodMission can improve mental health and wellbeing (Bakker et al., 2019), and two other studies published in scientific journals have provided further support (Bakker & Rickard, 2019; Bakker et al., 2018). Randomised controlled trials are the gold standard of scientific evidence, and very few available mental health apps have RCT support (Firth et al., 2018).

Completing Missions earns you rewards in the app, motivating you to take steps towards becoming healthier, happier, and more confident. Plus a Mission log helps you track your progress over time.

MoodMission learns which types of Missions work best for you, so the more you use MoodMission the better it gets at tailoring your Mission suggestions.

MoodMission is not a replacement for professional help. If you are experiencing anxiety, depression, or any mental health issue, talk to your GP or contact a psychologist for support.

title: BrainwaveX Depression
description:
BrainwaveX Depression is a brainwave therapy to reduce the symptoms of depression.

Depression is a state of low mood and aversion to activity that can affect a person's thoughts, behavior, feelings and sense of well-being. People with depressed mood can feel sad, anxious, empty, hopeless, helpless, worthless, guilty, irritable, ashamed or restless. They may lose interest in activities that were once pleasurable, experience overeating or loss of appetite, have problems concentrating, remembering details or making decisions, and may contemplate, attempt or commit suicide. Insomnia, excessive sleeping, fatigue, aches, pains, digestive problems or reduced energy may also be present.

Potential targets of brain areas to stimulate and reduce symptoms of depression are as follows:

BrainwaveX Depression consist of 3 different sessions. 
Session 1 and 2 are 4:30 minutes. 
Session 3 is 3 minutes. 

All sessions are needed to have a complete treatment!

Get ready for a total natural healing.

Enjoy your explorations.

http://www.brainwavex.com

title: Beck's Depression Inventory - BDI Screening Tool
description:
Beck's Depression Inventory App is one of the most widely used psychometric tests for measuring the severity of depression. The BDI App assesses the depression ranging from minimal depression to mild depression to moderate depression to severe depression. The assessment includes changes in sleep patterns and changes in appetite.

The Beck's Depression Inventory App measures the sadness, pessimism, past failure, loss of pleasure, punishment feeling, self-dislike, self-criticalness, guilty feeling, suicidal thoughts or wishes, agitated mind, loss of interest, indecisiveness, worthlessness, loss of energy, irritability, concentration difficulty, tiredness or fatigue and loss of interest in sex.

comments: Great app with easy-to-use interface. The icon happens to display my birthdate so it kinda won me over a little. Tried using it and another app for a few days and am glad it's so simple yet customisable. I also like that I can attach photos/videos in the diary. It's really like a diary on-the-go. Eventually uninstalled the other app and stuck with this. However, fingerprint unlocking is a little slow to react. Would be good if it can detect and unlock faster.

I've been using this app for more than a year. It's the most treasured diary app I have. I'm on premium and its the best. Thank you for the export to pdf function, its ingenious! And also all the back up and restore options. I was told that to log into my Google account I had to reinstall the app. It was nerve wrecking thinking about the chances of losing my data but everything worked fine. :)

Purchased the one-off premium feature, I got 50% and another RM2 discount. So far, I like the features. You can change the fonts, add pictures and emoji as emotions of your daily day. You can even take a look at others story, but you can choose to mute this feature. I wanted to write to express my emotions and I find out that this apps is compatible with my style, it's simple but all you need is there. Gonna use this for a very long time so I hope it'll always be this great! Thanks!

This app is really great!! ❤️ I Love it so much since the day i downloaded it to be honest. Its features are really cool. We could attach pictures, videos, gifs and audios etc.. And it has a mood tracks of our days and we could write our thoughts sooo much and has a lot of space to write. It even has a calendar to mark or anniversaries and can be added to all years.!!!I really love this app. Its more effective than writing a journal. 5 Stars.

I haven't had this app for long but this is great. I love the fonts and colors we can use. I also love how you can put it on private or share it with other people. Its amazing and even though not much people see it,I love it because its a diary for me but on the phone. Daily Life, your app is VERY GOOD

title: Psicologia de la Depresión
description:
En el app de Psicología de la Depresión encuentras información gratuita muy importante que puede ayudarte a conocer a grandes rasgos todo lo relacionado con uno de los trastornos psicológicos más complejos y delicados como lo es la depresión.
 
Hemos diseñado esta aplicación con palabras amigables en la cual podrás tener al alcance de tus manos conceptos que pueden brindarte gran utilidad  al momento de querer conocer :

*¿Qué es la depresión?
*¿Por qué es catalogado como uno de los trastornos psicológicos más delicados?
*¿Cómo vivir y apoyar a una persona con depresión?
*¿Cómo identificar la Depresión?

* Y mucho más....
  
Vivir inmerso en una situación tan penosa como la depresión no es nada fácil, por ello es muy importante para quienes se encuentran viviendo de forma directa o indirecta  la depresión conocer cómo la psicología contribuye al mejoramiento de los trastornos psicológicos y cómo la psicología permite encontrar alternativas que apoyan y ayudan a salir de la depresión.

Freud centró todo su interés en descifrar científicamente razones y conceptos de por qué los seres humanos enfermamos mentalmente, nosotros de una forma sencilla queremos compartir todo ello con ustedes a través de nuestra aplicación Psicología de la Depresión. 

Esperamos que nuestra información sea de gran utilidad, quisimos traer la psicología, consejos para la depresión y conceptos online de una forma entendible y amigable por medio de esta aplicación, con la única intención de ayudarte  a que conozcas cómo manejar de manera correcta la depresión. 

Sigmund Freud  con gran esmero trabajó para entender los trastornos psicológicos,  nosotros trabajamos con esta aplicación de Psicología de la Depresión para traer la psicología online y consejos de depresión al alcance de tus manos. 

*Sufrir de depresión no es una elección, pero vivir inmersa en ella es tu opción.

Puedes descargar Hoy Mismo esta aplicación de psicología gratis y psicología de la depresión para conocer un poco más acerca de este trastorno psicológico tan común como lo es la depresión, que afecta a miles de personas en todo el mundo. 

Nota: Con la información que compartimos en esta aplicación no pretendemos sustituir el consejo médico.  En caso de cualquier duda acuda a su médico. Esta información ha sido realizada por una psicóloga idónea.

title: Fight Depression Naturally Guide
description:
Fight Depression Naturally is an application that helps you how to overcome depression in a natural way When depressed, you may hear thoughts telling you to be alone, keep quiet and not to bother people with your problems. Again, these thoughts should be treated like parasites that try to keep your body from getting healthy. Do not listen to them. 


In this app we will discuss:

Dealing with depression
Fight Depression Naturally
how to deal with depression
Dealing with anxiety


features on the app:

_ update once a week
_ useful tips that we will provide
_ very simple display diapp


little explanation about Fight Depression Naturally :


When you feel bad, even if you feel embarrassed, confiding in a friend or voicing your struggles can lighten your burden and begin a process of ending your unhappiness. Talking about your problems or worries is not a self-centered or self-pitying endeavor. Friends and family, especially those who care about you, will appreciate knowing what's going on.

Even the simple act of putting yourself in a social atmosphere can lift your spirits. Go to a place where there are people who may have similar interests as you, or even to a public spot like a museum, park, or mall, where you could enjoy being amongst people. Never allow yourself to indulge in the thought that you are different from or less than anyone else. Everyone struggles at times, and your depression does not define who you are or single you out from others.

Get your heart rate up 20 minutes a day, five days a week, and it has been scientifically proven that you will feel better emotionally. Exercising releases neurochemicals called endorphins, which help to elevate your mood. Even just getting out of the house for a walk, a game of catch with your kids, or a trip to the gym is a medically proven method of improving the way you feel.

Feeling embarrassed or self-hating over your depression will only increase your symptoms and discourage you from seeking help. Your critical thoughts toward yourself will try to keep you down any way they can, including by attacking you for feeling down. It's important to take your side and have compassion for yourself at those difficult times. You Talking is a powerful way of combating your depression. If you feel bad, don't let anyone tell you it's no big deal or that you'll just get over it. There is nothing shameful about recognizing you have a problem you alone cannot seem to resolve and to seek the help of a therapist. Learning about the source of your pain can truly help alleviate its impact on your life by helping you to recognize and combat your critical inner voice.

Don't listen to these attacks when they tell you not to pursue your goals, to isolate yourself. This gives the voice even more power over you. Instead, when you notice these thoughts and attitudes starting to intensify and take precedence over your more realistic, positive ways of thinking, it is essential to identify them.

title: Mental Health Tracker: Mental Disorders Test
description:
Note: The content in this app were made in the light of psycom.net (a mental health platform). The whole app is intended for fun and education purposes. For serious treatment plans and diagnosis, one should always go to a professional doctor or psychologist.

In this app, you will find useful testing information regarding some of the most common mental disorders. Mental health is extremely important in one's life. You will be asked questions regarding specific mental health issues and at the end get a result. According to the result, you will also be getting recommendations regarding treatment. Get fruitful testing and treatment information regarding the following mental health and personality disorders:

1) Depression: Depression is a state of low mood and aversion to activity. It can affect a person's thoughts, behavior, motivation, feelings, and sense of well-being. It may feature sadness, difficulty in thinking and concentration and a significant increase or decrease in appetite and time spent sleeping. People experiencing depression may have feelings of dejection, hopelessness and, sometimes, suicidal thoughts. It can either be short term or long term. The core symptom of depression is said to be anhedonia, which refers to loss of interest or a loss of feeling of pleasure in certain activities that usually bring joy to people. Depressed mood is a symptom of some mood disorders such as major depressive disorder or dysthymia.

2) Sociopathy: Antisocial personality disorder (ASPD or APD) is a personality disorder characterized by a long-term pattern of disregard for, or violation of, the rights of others. A low moral sense or conscience is often apparent, as well as a history of crime, legal problems, or impulsive and aggressive behavior.

3) ADHD: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by difficulty paying attention, or excessive activity and acting without regards to consequences, which are otherwise not appropriate for a person's age. Some individuals with ADHD also display difficulty regulating emotions or problems with executive function.

4) Bipolar Disorder: Bipolar disorder, previously known as manic depression, is a mental disorder characterized by periods of depression and abnormally elevated moods. If the elevated mood is severe or associated with psychosis, it is called mania; if it is less severe, it is called hypomania. During mania, an individual behaves or feels abnormally energetic, happy, or irritable. Individuals often make impulsive decisions with little regard for the consequences. There is usually a reduced need for sleep during manic phases. During periods of depression, individuals may experience crying, a negative outlook on life, and poor eye contact with others.

5) Schizophrenia: Schizophrenia is a mental illness characterized by continuous or relapsing episodes of psychosis. Major symptoms include hallucinations (often hearing voices), delusions, and disorganized thinking. Other symptoms include social withdrawal, decreased emotional expression, and apathy. Symptoms typically come on gradually, begin in young adulthood, and in many cases never resolve. There is no objective diagnostic test; diagnosis is based on observed behavior, a history that includes the person's reported experiences, and reports of others familiar with the person.

6) Anxiety: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by significant feelings of anxiety and fear. Anxiety is a worry about future events, while fear is a reaction to current events. These feelings may cause physical symptoms, such as increased heart rate and shakiness. There are several anxiety disorders, including generalized anxiety disorder, specific phobia, social anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, agoraphobia, panic disorder, and selective mutism. The disorder differs by what results in the symptoms. An individual may have more than one anxiety disorder.

Enjoy!

2) Sociopathy: Antisocial personality disorder (ASPD or APD) is a personality disorder characterized by a long-term pattern of disregard for, or violation of, the rights of others. A low moral sense or conscience is often apparent, as well as a history of crime, legal problems, or impulsive and aggressive behavior.

3) ADHD: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by difficulty paying attention, or excessive activity and acting without regards to consequences, which are otherwise not appropriate for a person's age. Some individuals with ADHD also display difficulty regulating emotions or problems with executive function.

4) Bipolar Disorder: Bipolar disorder, previously known as manic depression, is a mental disorder characterized by periods of depression and abnormally elevated moods. If the elevated mood is severe or associated with psychosis, it is called mania; if it is less severe, it is called hypomania. During mania, an individual behaves or feels abnormally energetic, happy, or irritable. Individuals often make impulsive decisions with little regard for the consequences. There is usually a reduced need for sleep during manic phases. During periods of depression, individuals may experience crying, a negative outlook on life, and poor eye contact with others.

5) Schizophrenia: Schizophrenia is a mental illness characterized by continuous or relapsing episodes of psychosis. Major symptoms include hallucinations (often hearing voices), delusions, and disorganized thinking. Other symptoms include social withdrawal, decreased emotional expression, and apathy. Symptoms typically come on gradually, begin in young adulthood, and in many cases never resolve. There is no objective diagnostic test; diagnosis is based on observed behavior, a history that includes the person's reported experiences, and reports of others familiar with the person.

6) Anxiety: Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by significant feelings of anxiety and fear. Anxiety is a worry about future events, while fear is a reaction to current events. These feelings may cause physical symptoms, such as increased heart rate and shakiness. There are several anxiety disorders, including generalized anxiety disorder, specific phobia, social anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, agoraphobia, panic disorder, and selective mutism. The disorder differs by what results in the symptoms. An individual may have more than one anxiety disorder.

Enjoy!

title: DBT Coach: (Dialectical Behavior Therapy app)
description:
This is the most comprehensive DBT app that exists today with easy to follow visual tools.

Learn and practice DBT skills using video lessons and fun animations which helps you to remember skills longer. Features over 100 videos and 200+ animations. You can also take notes on these lessons for future use.

User friendly diary card for skills and target behaviors. Summary screens to check your progress. Analytics to get insight into your own behavior as you learn new skills. Ability to share with therapists and care team.

Track your progress on how you are doing and get motivated to obtain new skills. Get awards for tasks done towards obtaining new skills or keeping up with one you already know.

Complete exercises and practice ideas that are similar to worksheets in actual DBT skills training. There are over 100 exercises. You can also see a history of all the exercises that you did in the past to compare. Each of the exercise link directly to lessons.

Over 1000 meditations ranging across multiple themes from some of the best teachers in the world.

Favorites list to save skills and meditations you use frequently.

Crisis survival list to manage your crisis.

Community tools such as Discussion Groups and Peer Support Groups to help you practice and share knowledge about DBT Skills.

Finally, the app integrates with a clinician app. If your therapist is signed up and you are set up to share your diary card and exercises then you don’t have to share via email every week. Your therapist can engage with you in real time.

Dialectical behavior therapy (DBT) treatment is a type of psychotherapy — or talk therapy — that utilizes a cognitive-behavioral approach. It began with efforts to treat borderline personality disorder (also known as Emotional Instability Disorder). DBT has been conceptualized as a treatment that is broadly applicable for individuals who have difficulties regulating emotion. Empirical evidence now supports the use of DBT adapted for eating disorders, substance use disorders, and PTSD.

 Payment will be charged to your Playstore account at confirmation of purchase
*You have a choice of being billed monthly for $11.99/month or a discounted price of $59.99 every six months.

• Account will be charged for renewal within 24-hours prior to the end of the current period, and identify the cost of the renewal

• Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

recentChanges: Some bug fixes and performance enhancements.
comments: I really really like this app, DBT saved my life -- I still have much to improve upon. Practicing DBT on a daily basis has helped me to regain control of my emotions and allows me to stay focused and determined. DBT Coach is outstanding as a stand alone app, but for me personally it provides an effective substitution for a therapist during this transtion until I am able to afford individual sessions again.
For $11.99 a month the app keeps crashing when certain lessons are opened. So you're paying for an app the only some content works. It's a shame because if it worked properly it would be worth it.

The app is WAY overpriced. I would not balk for a minute at a $5.99/month subscription but this is priced out of the market, especially since it is a health care focused app. The language is not in vernacular English all the time, which is annoying. Hire an editor for clarity is a pretty minimal ask for short, static screens and would cost very little. The validation skill could be broken down to Self and Others because they are different skills. Ever since the upgrade to add the annoying Red Crisis Face, I cannot edit my entries or view the distress tolerance skills. So I have used this app for two weeks and now cannot access/use the data accurately for my appointment tomorrow. If reliability matters, don't use the free version of the app; I cannot speak to the reliability of the paid version.

I see potential. Needs better design and pricing. Will continue to use it to see how far I can go with free version. Also, needs someone to refresh the writing for a general audience. The video tour doesn't seem to work on my phone. Design is not intuitive. I had to figure it out by clicking around.
Like the app, but it doesn't save your entry more times than not. Very frustrating.

title: Depression Test & Help To Fight Depression
description:
Do feel like you're depressed, stressed, or might have a mental health issue? Use the test to check if you might have depression. Learn about depression and how to deal with depression. 

The PHQ-9 test consists of the actual nine criteria on which the diagnosis of DSM-IV depressive disorders is based. The diagnostic validity of the PHQ-9 is fully evidence based [1, 2]. The test has comparable sensitivity and specificity to many other extensive depression measures.

Disclaimer: This app is not intended to be a replacement for treatment nor any sort of medical intervention. Treatment is, by far, the best way to overcome clinical depression or other mental illnesses. Therapy and antidepressants have been shown to effectively treat clinical depression and anxiety. This application will only aid you on your path to recovery from depression or anxiety. In addition, if you are not in treatment, talk to your doctor or therapist or use this app to find resources that can connect you to treatment.

title: Geriatric Depression Scale 2.0
description:
The Geriatric Depression Scale is a screening device to identify depression in older adults. This is a free handheld version that can be used to administer and score the scale.

The background of the scale is found at: http://www.stanford.edu/people/yesavage/GDS.html

There are currently about 30 translations at the website.

This is the new Version 2.0 updated for Lollipop and option to mail results added.

Please note a new version is published called the Geriatric Depression Dementia (GDDS Screen), which expands to cover some cognitive complaints.

title: Depression Test - Renu Bala HAU
description:
The Beck Depression Inventory created by Aaron T. Beck, is a 21-question multiple-choice self-report inventory, one of the most widely used psychometric tests for measuring the severity of depression.
Historically, depression was described in psychodynamic terms as "inverted hostility against the self". The BDI was developed by collating patients' verbatim descriptions of their symptoms and then using these to structure a scale which could reflect the intensity or severity of a given symptom.
It contains 21 questions, each answer being scored on a scale value of 0 to 3. Higher total scores indicate more severe depressive symptoms.

It contains 21 questions, each answer being scored on a scale value of 0 to 3. Higher total scores indicate more severe depressive symptoms.

title: Talkspace Counseling & Therapy
description:
Talkspace is the most convenient and affordable way to improve your mental health. Get matched with a licensed therapist in your state from the comfort of your device, and message via text, audio, and video.

Unlike in-person therapy, which typically costs $150 for each weekly session, Talkspace is a subscription service, starting at only $65/week (billed monthly). All plans come with unlimited messaging, and you can even choose to add live video sessions. We also offer unlimited messaging therapy to teens ages 13-17 and special services for couples therapy. You can change therapists or stop subscription renewal at any time. 

HOW DOES TALKSPACE WORK? 

Tell us your preferences for therapy, and match with one of our therapists in your state the same day. Send your therapist unlimited text, audio, picture, or video messages from anywhere, at any time — you’ll hear back at least once a day, 5 days per week. 

IS TALKSPACE EFFECTIVE? 

Talkspace has been shown to be as effective as face-to-face therapy. In one recent study, 81% of participants felt Talkspace is as effective or better than in-person therapy. In another, individuals who used Talkspace for only 2 months significantly improved symptoms of depression and anxiety. Talkspace has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, CNN.com, Business Insider, and more. 

For more research data, visit research.talkspace.com. 
For more of our press coverage, visit talkspace.com/online-therapy/press/

WHO ARE THE TALKSPACE THERAPISTS?

The Talkspace provider network has thousands of licensed therapists across the 50 U.S. states who have been vetted and accredited according to NCQA standards. They have experience treating the most common mental health issues, including depression, anxiety, substance use, stress, relationships, PTSD, and more.

IS TALKSPACE SECURE?

Your safety and security are our #1 priorities. Our technology is protected using banking-grade encryption and externally audited in compliance with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). For more information, find our complete Privacy Policy at talkspace.com/public/privacy-policy.

CONNECT WITH US!

We’re always happy to connect with users and receive feedback.
Email us: support@talkspace.com 
Check out our website: talkspace.com 
Follow us on Twitter: twitter.com/Talkspace 
Follow us on Instagram: instagram.com/talkspace
Like us on Facebook: facebook.com/Talkspacetherapy

comments: Cannot book sessions. No customer support. My therapist was great, but haven't been able to book another session. This issue is not resolved!!!! Took customer support 13 days to get back to me and thier response did not help. I guess I have to wait another 13 days now...who knows? I'm so annoyed by this. I'm just going to cancel my membership - instead of Talkspace helping me with anything it's become another source of frustration in my life. Freakin' worthless.

I submitted a question to customer support 11 days ago and have not gotten a response yet. I want to cancel my account, but there is no button to cancel or deactivate. This app is terrible. The texting feature is one of the major reasons I signed up for Talkspace, but I didn't feel like I was getting my money's worth since my therapist does not respond for 8-12 hours. When she does respond, she just says she has some ideas that could help me, but that she will share them during our next session, making me wait several days for any sort of lifeline! I need help now! I'm paying for this service! On another similar therapy app, I was able to message back and forth with my therapist and get instant feedback. As for the video chats, I would have preferred if my therapist would have been stationed in one place the whole time instead of walking around her house. It was a bit unprofessional and even when she was sitting down because she had a tv on somewhere in the house and she was moving the camera all around making me sea sick. To make matters worse, I had no way of knowing if anyone at her house could hear our conversation! She had a lot of experience as a therapist, but admitted that she was new to Talkspace and had not yet read all of the handbook and all the rules she was supposed to follow as a provider. When we got booted out of our video call three times, she suggested that we FaceTime. Again, not professional! Talkspace is a secure platform where mental health information can be shared. FaceTime is not! I'm going back to the other app I was using before. It was slightly more expensive, but wayyyy better!

Do not waste your time or money with this app. My therapist has been really wonderful and responsive, but the app is absolute trash. I reached out to support and the only response I received was, "We've received your support request, and we'll get back to you as soon as we can." That's it. No actual response to my concern. I can't book new sessions because I "don't have any session credits available" and there's no obvious/visible way for me to even pay to book another session. To top it off, the sessions that I have booked with my therapist have been such poor quality that I am literally talking to a blank screen because her face never shows up, despite us both having very fast internet connection speeds. I'm really disappointed in the general usability of the app, the complete lack of customer service, and the quality of the calls between me and my therapist.

The issue has been resolved. Thank you! I was charged a total of 8 times in one month and still have not heard back from customer service or been issued a refund. On top of that, the app is still behaving as if i haven't renewed my subscription despite having taken 8 monthly charges out. If customer service ever reaches out and resolves the issue then I will change my rating because I love my therapist, but I dont like being multi-charged for a service I am not receiving.

Received an invite link to this service. The first therapist told us they could not accommodate video sessions, which is what we paid for. The second therapist did not respond to any messages. Talkspace seems unable or unwilling to provide the service we paid for.

title: Wellness Hub: Video Counselling app for Depression
description:
Issues at workplace? Bogged down by Stress? Relationship Issues? Marital Woes? Adolescent or Parenting Issues?

It's Time to TALK and drive away the worries.

Psychological Counselling Services through video with our qualified psychologists / psychiatrists / counselors / therapists / psychotherapists.

We are an entity in the mental wellness space working towards our vision of playing a vital role for your happier living. 

Online Counselling Services
We are glad you have considered Wellness Hub in your journey of becoming a better YOU
Our Experienced, Empathetic and Non-Judgmental Psychologists are here for YOU

Here’s a list of our products:

Online Video Counselling:
Introducing our Anytime, Anywhere Affordable and Secure Therapy. Our experienced and empathetic therapists are just a click away. Buy video credits, book an appointment with an expert of your choice and relax. Login to our app at the time of your appointment and start interacting with your psychologist/psychiatrist through our state of art video chat interface. 

Online counselling is a boon for modern mankind, thanks to technology. Though technology has been held responsible for some of the problems being faced by mankind, it is the same technology that has become a tool for providing professional counselling services to people. Online counselling, an example of optimum utilization of technology, allows people to use counselling services from any corner of the world; saves time and ensures the same anonymity as provided by face-to-face counselling. An understanding of the nature, process and importance of counselling is warranted before an examination of the significance of online counselling.

Counselling begins with the wish or intent of the client to seek help for the problem(s) that were not resolved either by self or with the help of family members, friends or co-workers. The client then asks the counsellor to provide time and space to share feelings and experiences and find solutions to the problems. The counsellor builds a relationship that provides the client an opportunity to speak without inhibitions and confidentiality is assured. The client is allowed to voice his/her experiences and feelings that have been silenced. The counsellor sets aside his/her own needs or positions on issues brought by the client, and focuses completely on helping the client articulate and act on his/her personal values and desires. The counselling relationship is thus an expression of a set of core values: honesty, integrity, care, belief in the worth and value of individual persons and a sense of the common good.

Outcomes of counselling
Counselling aims to being about changes in the clients thinking, feeling and acting. These include the following:

Understanding the origins and development of emotional difficulties in order to develop the capacity to take rational control over their feelings and actions.
Acquire a general competence in problem-solving
Acquire ideas and techniques with which to understand and control behaviour.
Learn and master social and interpersonal skills such as maintaining eye contact, conducting conversations, and displaying assertiveness and anger control
Initiate and sustain changes in their irrational beliefs or maladaptive thought patterns and behaviors.
Become more empowered so that they could take control of their own lives
Make amends for previous destructive behaviour and develop a desire or capacity to care for others.

Wellness Hub has a team of professionally trained counsellors who offer their services online at designated times. Online counselling starts with the client taking an appointment for consultations with the counsellor. At the appointed time, the counsellor joins the video call with the client and initiates a discussion to understand the client’s problem.

title: PHQ-9 Depression module
description:
Patient Health Questionnaire: PHQ-9 is the depression module

The PHQ-9 is a 9-question instrument given to patients in a primary care setting to screen for the presence and severity of depression. It is the 9-question depression scale from the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ). The results of the PHQ-9 may be used to make a depression diagnosis according to DSM-IV criteria and takes less than 3 minutes to complete. The total of all 9 responses from the PHQ-9 aims to predict the presence and severity of depression. Primary care providers frequently use the PHQ-9 to screen for depression in patients.

title: Am I Depressed?
description:
Have you been feeling sad or depressed lately? Not enjoying your usual activities? Has your energy been low? If you have been wondering if your mood might be a problem for you or something you might need help with, this app may be for you.

The purpose of this app is to help you explore whether or not your mood is a problem for you. Based on your answers, the app will direct you to activities that may be helpful. For example, the app can help you learn how to recognize the signs of depression and look at different areas of your life to see if depression is affecting you. You can also get information on whether your mood is normal for your age or something you might need help with. If you feel depression might be something you need help with, the app can teach you strategies for dealing with depression. You can also set goals for working on your mood.

This app:
- Was designed for youth 12-18 years old, with the input of youth
- Does not collect personal information, with all the information you provide stored locally on your device

Please be aware that:
- You may use this app if you are above 18 years of age; however, some of the features of the app may not work for your age group
- You may want to consider password protecting your device to keep your information private
- This app and its contents are designed for information purposes only and cannot be used to diagnose or treat depression or other mental health problems.
- This app is not a substitute for professional mental health care or emergency services.

Am I Depressed? was created by Dr. Julie Eichstedt, Dr. Devita Singh, and Dr. Kerry Collins, clinical psychologists with many years of experience in child and adolescent mental health, in collaboration with mindyourmind and input from youth volunteers. It was programmed and designed by Red Square Labs, with support from the Children's Health Foundation, and its donors, including the John and Jean Wettlaufer Family.

title: CBT Tools for Healthy Living, Self-help Mood Diary
description:
Mood log and analysis, CBT diary, healthy goals & more!

Feel hopeful about changing your life! Learn the cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) methods shown in psychological research to be effective in changing emotions/mood and behavior.

CBT tools included in this app
1) Cognitive Diary
• step by step evaluation of an event that caused distress 
• to help with cognitive restructuring

2) Inspire Diary
• a simple diary method 
• to provide affirmations and record positive events

3) Tests
• to help you learn about yourself
• Cognitive Styles Test, Your Happiness Assessment and more

4) Healthy Activities Log
• track daily activities to motivate and make improvements

5) Mood Log 
• record your moods throughout the day
• mood analysis feature: shows your average mood ratings for different actions or events
• graphs to track your mood

6) Points Log 
• with encouraging messages
• tracks progress and provides motivation
• earn points to remove display ads for a week at a time

7) Daily Goals 
• to plan your healthy activities
• treatment planning with therapist

8) Links
• to relaxation and assistance audios on the Excel At Life website

About cognitive-behavioral therapy
CBT Tools for Healthy Living by Excel At Life teaches you how to use the cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) methods in a simple format. The tools provided in this app are  derived from the CBT research base and developed into a user-friendly format by a psychologist with over 30 years of clinical experience.

Learn the CBT methods shown by decades of psychological research to be effective for changing your emotions/moods and behavior that contribute to depression, anxiety and stress, as well as problems in relationships, career and physical health.

These CBT methods can be used as self-help for minor issues or can be used in collaboration with your therapist to develop a treatment plan best suited to your situation. The Daily Goals feature can be used to record your plan and completed activities.

Other features
• All personal data stored in your device.
• Fully customizable: change the CBT terms (beliefs and definitions) used in the diary to conform with the system you are familiar with, add your own challenging statements for each belief, add moods/emotions, add healthy activities to track
• Password protection (optional)
• Daily reminder (optional)
• Examples, tutorial, articles
• Email entries and test results - useful for therapeutic collaboration
• Remove ads by earning points or watching short ad video.

The tools provided in this app are derived from the CBT research base and developed into a user-friendly format by a psychologist with over 30 years of clinical experience.

Learn the CBT methods shown by decades of psychological research to be effective for changing your emotions/moods and behavior that contribute to depression, anxiety and stress, as well as problems in relationships, career and physical health.

These CBT methods can be used as self-help for minor issues or can be used in collaboration with your therapist to develop a treatment plan best suited to your situation. The Daily Goals feature can be used to record your plan and completed activities.

Other features


• All personal data stored in your device.
• Fully customizable: change the CBT terms (beliefs and definitions) used in the diary to conform with the system you are familiar with, add your own challenging statements for each belief, add moods/emotions, add healthy activities to track
• Password protection (optional)
• Daily reminder (optional)
• Examples, tutorial, articles
• Email entries and test results - useful for therapeutic collaboration
• Remove ads by earning points or watching short ad video.
summary: In Healthline.com: Best Depression Apps of 2020!  Free - no paid upgrades needed
recentChanges: Improved customization
comments: This app is perfect. I've been searching for a while for something to help myself and use techniques that are forgotten if not kept at hand. I literally can't fault a single thing about it. THANK YOU!
Clean and user-friendly interface. Very useful if you want to write about your feelings, goals, experiences and personal development.

Amazing app. Full of features to help with negative thoughts, track your mood and set goals. Plus loads of info to help you learn more about CBT and yourself. I'd rate much higher than 5 stars if I could. When mental health services let me down I would credit this app with literally saving my life.
Sensible and practical CBT, helps you feel better about your efforts, and gives insight.

I recently came across this and I find it enjoyable and helpful. I'm not sure how I feel about the points yet, but it seems like a cool idea. I like that it has tests, organized set ups for different types of diary logs. It also gives you ideas and helpful tips. It makes it easier to decide how you're feeling and gauge how strongly you're feeling it. Lots of options and articles, and more! This is pretty cool, I'll be telling people about this app.

title: Wana: we are not alone
description:
Wana is a community platform that fosters hope, direction, and healing for people with chronic and invisible illnesses. Think of us like the social network for health, specifically designed to help the millions of people who live with conditions like Lyme disease, chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia, Crohn’s disease, Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, endometriosis, and POTS, among many others. No matter what chronic or invisible illness you face, Wana will remind you--every time you log on--that you are not alone. 

Wana was built by a team of people who live with chronic and invisible conditions and understand what our community members are going through. Our founders met by chance and connected over their shared health stories: mysterious symptoms, frustrating misdiagnoses, and a sense of isolation. As they bonded over their symptoms, shared advice about treatments, and supported each other in finding answers, their health challenges became a lot less overwhelming. They got better, together. 

Wana was created for people like you and people like us. It’s the answer to the confusion, overwhelm, and loneliness that often comes with living with an invisible or chronic condition. At Wana, illness doesn't isolate us--it connects us. Whatever your health story looks like, you belong on Wana. 

HOW YOU CAN USE THIS APP

CONNECT
- Share your story and connect with people who understand what you’re going through
- Get recommended matches and match with people by symptoms, age, and distance
- Chat one-on-one or post on the Wana feed to get answers and support in real-time
- Be a resource and shoulder to lean on for people who are dealing with a new diagnosis

LEARN
- Investigate diagnoses, symptoms, and treatments with the WanaLibrary, our information powerhouse
- Go deep with top podcasts, books, and videos related to each diagnosis, symptom, and treatment
- Find clarity in the resources created and curated by our experts (MDs, naturopaths, nutritionists, and more)

DISCOVER
- Get recommendations for treatments and practitioners that have helped other Wana members
- Uncover your individual approach to wellness, whether that’s conventional, integrative or both 
- Find treatments that are a good fit, try them with support from your practitioners, and report back

Common diagnoses among Wana community members include:
- Fibromyalgia
- Endometriosis
- Lyme disease
- Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
- POTS
- IBS
- Migraines
- Depression
- Allergies
- Chronic fatigue syndrome
- PCOS
Common symptoms among Wana community members include:
- Anxiety
- Fatigue
- Depressive thinking
- Body pain
- Headaches
- Brain fog
- Bloating
- Difficulty focusing
- Food allergies and sensitivities 
- Joint pain
- Insomnia
- Social anxiety

THE BUZZ ABOUT WANA
**Featured in Billboard.com story about Justin Bieber’s Lyme diagnosis**
**Also featured by Bustle  and Thrive Global**

Download the app and join the Wana community today!
If you don’t see your diagnosis, symptoms, or go-to treatment listed yet, let us know! As Wana grows, the WanaLibrary will grow with it. Get in touch by emailing our community manager, WanaMama, at hello@joinwana.com. Our inbox is always open to you, and we give thought and care to every message.

Let’s get better together. See you on the app!
TeamWana

recentChanges: Notification center!
comments: I would sugjest updating the blocking/reporting patt of the app. I want to be able to do more specific reports on the app. And for the blocking portion I wish to be able to block/unblock easier, have a list of the blocked profiles, and when someone is blocked their presense is hidden. I have a serious issue with one of your users harrassing/bulling me. I would love for her to leave the app or just at least not be able to find me.

I like it so far. I do wish we could choose which of our diagnoses end up on our feed. My feed is swamped with depression posts, but I really just joined for support with PTSD. I still have depression, so I don't necessarily want to remove it from diagnoses, but I think I'll have to just so I can get the information I actually need.

This app is overrun with spam, fake accounts, and people trying to scam others. There's also a number of people who are rude and abusive even though it's supposed to be a support app. Reporting people does nothing because the people are never removed even if several people report them several times each. And if someone harasses you in a DM there's no way to report it.

very excited for this app to develop more with interface problems, everything else is perfect. i can't find a way to follow or even open people's community pages, so i'm pretty sure it's a glitch. hope it gets fixed ASAP as it really makes the app less useful.
Whenever I try to create an account, everything goes fine until I have to upload a profile picture. Everytime I do, the app crashes and I have to start all over.

title: Words Of Encouragement For Depression
description:
Words Of Encouragement For Depression. Teenage Depression to Postpartum Depression depressing wallpapers.

You're not alone and your depression is not a sign of weakness or a character ... Nothing seems fun anymore—even the activities you used to love,  and you just don’t see the point of forcing yourself to do them. Teenage depression is more than just sadness or moodiness – it's a ... your child might not want to go to a friend's party, or she might say that she feels lonely 

Same way,  Postpartum depression does not occur because of something a mother does or ... Losing interest in activities that are usually enjoyable. What can happen if postpartum depression is not treated? 

While we do not offer counselling, our app offers quotes for the very situation you are facing. The quotes offer a ray of hope. If not anything, it will surely distract you from the sadness and depression thus giving you a moment to take a holistic look at your issues and give you a new energy , positive vibes to boost your moral and mental strength

title: Appiness stress, anxiety and depression relief
description:
Appiness is the leader community focused on mental wellbeing. We will help you relax your mind, calm down and fight anxiety, stress and depression. 

How Appiness will help you? We are the founders of a new methodology called Personal Debugging created through the combination of current psychology mastery, ancient meditation techniques and new disciplines like computer science. 

Have you ever questioned yourself why self-help, meditation apps and many relaxation techniques don't work as expected? Did you read tons of books about how to "feel better" or meditate and didn't work? Is your anxiety still there after that? Yes, mostly because they don't take into account the most important key of everything: yourself.  

How does it work? Personal Debugging helps you to learn about yourself, who you really are, the real YOU. And knowing yourself is the only driver to understand about your concerns and worries and tackle them in a proper way, only for you and your personality. Everyone is a different being. 

Who we are? Appiness are a group of professional experts in different areas (psychology, meditation and computer science) and a community of users that share the same concerns and walked the same way you are now. We focus on helping each other and mastering Personal Debugging. We will help you understand the cause of your concerns and adapt properly. 

In what areas can Personal Debugging help you?

* Learning about your personality traits and how they affect your life.
* Manage anxiety
* Fight common disorders such as stress or depression
* Sleep better
* Learn to relax and meditate.
* Mindfulness techniques.
* Improve your self-esteem
* Calm and relax and understanding the reasons sometimes you cannot easily achieve it

Appiness offers you:

* Discover your type of personality based on one of the 16 personality types and what are your traits.
* Track your stress, anxiety and depression levels.
* Relax and calm contents, such as guided meditation audios from different authors
* A community to share your thoughts, raise questions and read about hot topics related to mind concerns.
* A journal where you can track your daily thoughts and feelings.
* Lessons to learn about yourself based on Cognitive Behavioural Therapy
* Daily tasks about exercises, relax techniques to try and food recommendations to improve your mental and physical health

We hope we will really help you!

title: Mood Potatoes - Mood Tracker | Mental Health Diary
description:
What makes you happy and grateful for the things you have in your life? How do you usually track your mental health conditions? Do you know what type of daily habits triggers your mind and helps you maintain and improve your mental wellbeing? How about the routines that you can implement in your life to improve your mental health?
Well, Mood Potatoes is a free mood tracker app for iOS/Android that helps you find the answers to the mentioned questions and does whatever it takes to help you find the better version of yourself, be happier and more satisfied, reach a stable mental health condition, and much more. 
So, if you find yourself with mental health concerns, likely to be in the recovery journey of depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, addiction, alcoholism or other unhealthy habits), and looking for an effective yet simple solution to improve your mental health conditions, download Mood Potatoes for free on your iPhone or iPad (Android phone or tablet) and start tracking your mood daily and get into the habit of recording a gratitude journal.
3 simple steps to improve mental wellness in less than 5 minutes a day 
Record your mood. Associate the mood with colors. Record in the gratitude journal. Rinse and repeat.  Consistency is key here. Mood Potatoes is a simple app to integrate in your daily life and will become a new best friend. 
A professional mood tracker app to maintain a healthy mental state
Mood Potatoes, the free anti-depression app for Android/iOS, comes with a clean and neat design and the interface is so user-friendly that you will get the whole idea as soon as registering your mood on the first day without having to go through a complex procedure. 
Every day, you get to register your current mood and level of happiness by choosing one of the following mental conditions: Unhappy, Moody, Neutral, Good, and Joyful, along with the option to write down the things you are grateful for today. The monthly view enables you to see your overall mood status in a month at a glance and help you get a better understanding of your mental condition and its trend.

A self-care journal to track Daily happiness & gratitude
Mood journaling has never been this fun and easy with Mood Potatoes. Keeping a gratitude journal has been proven to not only improve your mental wellbeing and self-esteem but also helps you sleep better and be happier and more positive. Your personal journaling companion is here to help you track your daily happiness and encourage you to get into a daily habit of recording a gratitude journal. 

Why don’t you give this mood tracker and anti-depression app a try?
No matter where you are in the recovery journey of depression or anxiety, you are confident to overcome unhealthy habits such as addiction or alcoholism, or you just want to be happier in your life, we’ve got you covered.
The high-quality graphics, smooth animations with fun illustrations, the option to track mood and create a self-care journal, a wide range of suggestions on self-care activities, and intuitive interface are just a few reasons that make this mood journaling app your #1 choice when it comes to finding the best mood tracker app for iOS/Android. 
And since the entire features of this anti-depression and habit enforcer app are available for free, there is no harm giving it a try and exploring the features for yourself. 
Download Mood Potatoes for free on your Android/iOS device and let us know about any bugs, questions, feature requests or any other suggestions.

comments: This app is amazing!!!! I suffer from schizophrenia and D.I.D and I am so glad I stumbled across this app honestly its a great way to track your moods and I love the gratitude entries as well. A great tool to help you learn how to recognize and understand your moods as well as help you to think more positively

The app is useful. It's simple. I like the interface. No ads. But I don't know why everytime i open the app i have to log in. I just automatically get logged out. It happened 4 days in a row. I am frustrated with this thing now.
I have seen a lot of apps like this, but this was the simplest one and I loved it!
It is simple and I love the name. Looks good, no ads.
I like it. It's simple but good.

title: Depression Guide
description:
This mobile app provide useful knowledge about depression.

knowledge is power.

Depression guide is knowledge sharing mobile app.

While we all feel sad, moody or low from time to time, some people experience these feelings intensely, for long periods of time (weeks, months or even years) and sometimes without any apparent reason. Depression is more than just a low mood .Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act.

Depression is a state of low mood and aversion to activity that can affect a person's thoughts, behaviour, feelings, and sense of well-being. A depressed mood is a normal temporary reaction to life events such as loss of a loved one

You do not need to get online or download.Easy to read it in list mode and navigation between questions. Easy search by text and numbers.

Features:

Easy to use user interface.
Offline Access.
Search facility using keywords.

This app help you to increase knowledge in your free time in house or any public place while travelling,relaxing in garden,waiting in queue, travelling in a bus or train, at work or at home.

title: Hypnosis for Anxiety, Stress Relief & Depression
description:
Listen to audio affirmations, programs, courses, and workshops to help you reduce anxiety, get over your fears, reduce stress and stressful situations, overcome your phobias, become more confident in social settings, and relax more.

OVERCOME THE FEAR THAT CRIPPLES YOU: Do you feel like your fears keep you in a box of familiarity? Are you tired of letting your anxiety rule your life? With the help of the expert-facilitated hypnosis courses, meditation tracks, and affirmations, you can step into your role as the courageous creator within the parameters of your life. 

CONQUER YOUR PHOBIA OF SOCIAL SITUATIONS: Do social situations make you nervous? Do you wish you were more confident and brave when out in public? Discover your ability to swoon a person of the opposite sex, perform in front an audience, get over your fear of heights, and hold a tarantula through the power of hypnosis and meditation. 

BE COURAGEOUS AND FACE YOUR FEARS: Have you wished that you would live your life with more courage? Are you tired of feeling afraid of new things? With the plethora of audio programs, hypnosis workshops, and guided meditations in this app, you can develop the courage to go skydiving, travel alone, and learn to live more fearlessly.

description:
Quickly reduce stress, stay calm, stay healthy, reduce anxiety and understand yourself by taking the time to breathe (understand inhale, exhale, sustain and retain).

Breathe: Stress Relief Meditation app offers best exercise trainings such as Feel fresh, Relax, Concentration, Calming, Self-Healing, Stress Relief and Peace of mind.

title: Depression - Mental Health Awareness
description:
Depression (major depressive disorder or clinical depression) is a common but serious mood disorder. It causes severe symptoms that affect how you feel, think, and handle daily activities.It is more than just feeling sad, upset or unmotivated from time to time, but depression is way more serious. 

It is a mood disorder characterized by prolonged feelings of sadness and loss of interest in daily activities. If these symptoms persist for a period of at least two weeks, it is considered you've diagnose with major depressive disorder.

Find out on what cause depression, the risk factor, sign & symptoms and the treatments and prevention step to be taken from it to re-occurring by download this essential mental health info awareness app!

App Features:
- 100% free to download.
- No In-app purchases needed.
- User friendly app navigation and design.
- Lightweight app design and required small storage space to install.
- Share function ready to spread this awareness among your friends and family trough your favorite social media app platform.

App Contain:
- Overview: Explaination & type of depression.
- Sign & Symptoms: Sign and Symptoms of what occur depression.
- Risk Factor: What major cause of this major depressive disorder
- Treatments: Treatments and prevention step for this mental health disorder.
- Great info-graphic included for more graphical information.

Remember, Prevention is better than cure. That is why it is essential for us gain awareness and deeper understanding on depression before it getting serious that potentially lead to suicide.

title: Depression Stress Anxiety Sad
description:
This Therapy in English helps you to reduce your Stress or Depression; finish once for all with your Sorrows, Stress, Depression, Anxiety, Sadness, …
  
This Anti Depression Therapy is oriented to you, whether you are a woman or a man.
 
This therapy can be used by people of all ages, adults, youngsters, old people and even children.
 
You have to listen one Session per day, during three days, for example, Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
 
You can always hear a Session, every time you feel more fragile or insecure.
 
The Psychological Software Anti Depression InMental is an audio file that you will listen using headphones from your Tablet, PDA, iPOD, Smart Phone, Notebook, Computer, iPhone, iPad, ITAB ... exactly as listening to music, but we recommend that you do so with your eyes closed and in a comfortable resting position, as your bed, or in a nursing chair.
 
You should sit or lie down comfortably in a quiet place, preferably your bedroom. Before you begin, make yourself at home, remove shoes, and go to the bathroom if needed. Wrap up with a blanket in case you feel cold. Turn off cell phones, alarms, bells. Tell your friends and family not to bother you. You will need silence for the next 60-90 minutes.
 
We recommend you to connect your device directly to the electric power to keep the battery fully charged, during the entire session.
 
You are about to start the experience, probably, the most exciting of your life.
 
Put the headphones in your ears, turn on your device: Tablet, PDA, iPOD, Smart Phone, CD Player, Laptop or computer, iPhone, iPad, ITAB, ... CLOSE YOUR EYES and let yourself go ...
 
The Psychological Software InMental.com EN in English is a fantastic way for you to relax, to feel cheerful and happy during the all day.
 
You can install it on your Smart Mobile Phone with Android or Tablet and walk always with him. You can always hear a Session, every time you feel more fragile or insecure.
 
If you want to feel relaxed, with good humor and cheerful throughout the entire day, try the PsychologicSoftware.com from the InMentalInstitute.com in English (EN).
 
By the way: PT is the Portuguese version, EN is the English version, ES is the Spanish version and FR is the French version.
 
Remember: this APP is not a video game. This is a Psychological Therapy oriented to your Sub-Conscience, with the objective to solve your psychological problems.

title: Mindset Depression
description:
MINDSET
Mindset gives you tools to help you better understand and live well with depression.

Step by Step
With Mindset’s eight-week program, you’ll learn to:
- Identify the cycle of depression
- Understand why and how self-help exercises based upon the principles of CBT can help
- Recognize unhelpful thoughts and thinking patterns
- See how actions impact mood
- Plan activities that make you feel good
- Use mindfulness to focus your attention on the present
- Identify unhealthy core beliefs and develop more balanced, healthy ones

title: Depression Monitor
description:
Depression Monitor is used to detect and monitor your depression or mood.
It has 9 questions based on our team observations.  To get best result, Please read each question carefully, and indicate how often you have experienced the same or similar challenges in the past 2 weeks.

Depression monitor helps you to detect depression in early phase. Analyzing your mood is good thing to detect depression in early phase. You will get idea about your mood or depression.

You can analyze your depression progress from your depression history and you can work on that. All these information will be saved in your phone only. We value your privacy, So we don't store any information on our server.

DISCLAIMER: This test is designed by our team on our observations. It is not depression diagnostic test. This test is not for professional treatment. Please consult a doctor if you concern about your mood.

Give feedback on : DepressionMonitor@gmail.com

title: STOP Depression
description:
STOP Depression by measuring it and taking steps to organize your life.
The STOP Depression application has following features:
1. Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 (PHQ-9) Test
2. PHQ-15 Test
3. First Aid
And more to come!

The copyright for the PHQ-9 was formerly held with Pfizer, who provided the educational grant for Drs Spitzer, Williams and Kroenke who originally designed it. This is no longer the case and no permission is required to reproduce, translate, display or distribute the PHQ-9.

NOTE, this app is helpful in assessing the degree of depression, but is not intended to give diagnosis. If you think this is necessary, please contact a professional.

title: Fight Depression - Take Baby Steps to Conquer It
description:
While depression is a low energy state and anxiety a high energy state, anxiety and depression are closely intertwined with each other. Inside, a depressed person often experiences a lot of anxiety – sometimes even leading to panic attacks.

Having panic attacks can itself be a depressing thing. Any lack of control within our lives can contribute to a depressed state.

Both anxiety and depression treatment are similar, which may explain why the two disorders are so often confused. 

Antidepressant medication is often used for anxiety and depression and behavioral therapy frequently helps people overcome both conditions.

Depression generates emotions such as hopelessness, despair and anger. Energy levels are usually very low, and depressed people often feel overwhelmed by the day-to-day tasks. 

But there is hope. With the right help and tools you can overcome depression once and for all. 

This app is developed to help anyone feeling depressed since weeks, months or ages. You will learn how you can fight against depression (and defeat it) taking few small baby steps starting today!

title: Online Counseling - Feel less depression & anxiety
description:
………………………………………………………………….
Install the ONLINE COUNSELING APP to your device
and soon you'll be ON YOUR WAY to better mental health
………………………………………………………………….


 Talk about your feelings with an accredited online counselor 
 Get matched with a licensed professional counselor
 Chat or talk with your therapist online or on the phone
 Receive 24/7 counseling services in all time zones
 Much more affordable than a traditional therapy appointment 
 Your personal privacy is secured. Discretion guaranteed!

The Online Counseling app brings you online professional counselors to help deal with feelings of phobia, depression, anxieties and other behavioral disorders.

Online therapy has been the chosen method of counseling psychology from quite some time now, as more people are opting for this convenient way of therapy.

With the Online Counseling app you can now access the accredited therapist that will guide you to a healthier and more stable way of coping.

………………………………………………………………….
Getting matched with your counselor on the spot 

By answering a simple guiding questionnaire you are then directed to the psychotherapy expert trained in that field in which you need assistance overcoming. You can also choose from a list of alternative online counselors to find your adequate mental guide, as long as you feel comfortable - that's the most important thing.

But mostly, as oppose to old school therapy, you needn't worry yourself with going through the tedious process of wasting time. Trying out various therapists is an easy route with the online counseling app, that doesn't involve driving long distances, paying obscenely large amounts of money or anxiously waiting for your next appointment…

………………………………………………………………….
Talking to your therapist is so much easier

Having been matched with the right therapist, you're now on your way to begin your online sessions. You can choose various ways of communication, from online chat or messaging to voice sessions. Most app users combine these tools, conducting weekly sessions as needed, and in addition sending messages to their counselor updating them on their progress or asking them to contact in case they feel the need.

………………………………………………………………….
Honest help a from behavioral therapy specialist
The Online Counseling app hosts numerous therapists and psychoanalysts, all versed in up-to-date methods of treating depression and anxiety. From CBT specialists to biofeedback experts, your mental health is in the best of hands. All our therapists are licensed practitioners who have completed their training and accumulated hundreds of hours in practical experience. You can examine their qualifications and view their diploma on their personal card available on the Online Counseling app site.

………………………………………………………………….
Download the Online Counseling app to any of your devices
Get professional aid to make positive behavioral change; overcome feelings of depression, anxiety & phobias in your daily life!

title: Sad Quote Wallpapers
description:
You don't always have to hide your tears and sadness! Be yourself with these honest wallpapers that don't try to pretend that everything is okay.

When you're feeling depressed and sad, sometimes is just makes it worse to fake a smile. It's okay to be yourself and let the world see that you're not perfect. While the wallpapers in this app reflect your sadness and hurting, they also serve another purpose; they remind you that you are not alone in your suffering. There are many other souls out there who know the pain and loneliness of depression or a broken heart. Take comfort in the refreshing honesty of these heart-wrenching wallpapers. Each wallpaper in this app features a beautiful or meaningful background paired with a quote about struggling against your own mind and emotions.

Don’t hide any longer - express your true feelings with wallpapers that reflect your inner struggle. Maybe someone will recognize your pain and offer you a hug today...

title: Signs & Symptoms Depression
description:
The Signs & Symptoms Depression helps the patients to self-manage Depression, using interactive tools. This app gives the patient important information regarding signs and symptoms of Depression and management of the disease.This app also allows the patient to record and track Depression levels along time with an incredible graphing option. The patient can show these records to the doctor and together improve the patient’s quality of life.  This app also allows the patient to remember when and which medication to take to manage Depression. 

Besides, the user can test its knowledge regarding Depression in an amusing way through a little and funny quiz. 

Some information provided may not be valid for residents of other countries due to variations in medical practice and drug approval and indications.

This patient education application provides patients and Health Care Practitioners with easy to access information on Depression management.
